text: A simple GAME SHOW SET -- one long desk-that houses four "CELEBRITY PANELISTS," a small pulpit with attached micro for the host, BUD COLLYER, who walks through the curtain the delight of the audience. Bud bows and waves to the celebrities -- ORSON BEAN, KITTY CARLISLE, TOM POSTON, an PEGGY CASS.
Hello, panel, and welcome everyone to another exciting day on "To Tell The Truth." Let's get the show started.

BRIGHT LIGHTS SHINE on the faces of THREE MEN who walk to center stage. All thre n wear identical AIRLINE PILOT UNIFORMS, each with m; c ng blue blazers and caps. (cont' d) Gentleman, please state your names.
My name is Frank Abagnale Jr. THE PILOT IN THE MIDDLE steps forward.
My name is Frank Abagnale Jr. THE THIRD PILOT does the same.
My name is Frank Abagnale Jr. Bud smiles, grabs a piece of paper.
Panel, listen to this one. (he starts to read) My name is Frank Abagnale Jr, and some people consider me the worlds greatest imposter.
Debbie Zane - 2.
As Bud reads, the CAMERA SLOWLY PANS the faces of the thr PILOTS. BUD COLLYER (cont'd)

From 1964 to 1966 I successfully impersonated an airline pilot for Pan Am Airlines, and flew over two million miles for free. During that time I was also the Chief Resident Pediatrician at a Georgia hospital, the Assistant Attorney General for the state of Louisiana, and a Professor of American History at a prestigious University in France. By the time I was caught and sentenced to prison, I had cashed over six million dollars in fraudulent checks in 26 foreign countries and all fifty states, and I did it all before my 18th birthday. To this day, I am the only teenager ever to have been placed on the FBI' s most wanted list. My name is a Abagna l e Jr. Warm applause as the THREE MEN walk behind a desk that faces the pa They all sit down at exactly the same time. BUD COLLY (cont'd ) Okay, panel, you have ork cut out for you. Kitty Carl , you have the first question.
Imposter number one, how many years were you in prison?
I served two years in France, and five years in Atlanta, Georgia.
Imposter number two, I find all this very fascinating. Who was it that finally caught you?

The New Rochelle Rotary Club has a history that goes back to 1859. So please stand, as I present my good friend, Frank William Abagnale. Applause all around as FRANK ABAGNALE SR. steps up to the MICROPHONE. But most of all, I am honored to see my loving wife, Paula, and my son, Frank Jr., sitting in the front-row. I'm just a business man, a working stiff -- but tonight you have made me royalty. And for this, I am eternally grateful. The men applaud as Frank Sr. smiles down at his wife and son, giving them a wink as he raises the plaque in the ai
